meanings.definition: To bend or curve upward in the middle.
meanings.sent1: The wooden plank was hogging in the center.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was hogging due to the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent3: The cat was hogging the warm spot by the fireplace all evening.
meanings.sent4: The bookshelf was hogging all the attention in the room.
meanings.sent5: The balloon was hogging the sky, floating higher and higher.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming greedily or selfishly.
meanings.sent1: His hogging of the cookies left none for others.
meanings.sent2: The hogging of resources by some countries leads to shortages for others.
meanings.sent3: Her hogging of the TV remote caused a family dispute.
meanings.sent4: The hogging of the spotlight by the singer annoyed the other performers.
meanings.sent5: The hogging of the playground equipment by the older kids upset the younger ones.

meanings.definition: A person who is greedy or selfish.
meanings.sent1: The hogging refused to share the toys with the other children.
meanings.sent2: The teacher talked to the hogging about the importance of sharing.
meanings.sent3: The hogging at the party ate all the snacks before others could have any.
meanings.sent4: The hogging in the group always wanted things their way.
meanings.sent5: The hogging in the office took credit for others' work.
